newsitem.title: JAPAN: Ford launches 50 bln yen 5.0% yen/US$ samurais.
newsitem.headline: Ford launches 50 bln yen 5.0% yen/US$ samurais.

text.p: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday launched 50 billion yen worth of 5.0 percent yen/U.S. dollar dual currency samurai bonds due November 29, 1999, lead-manager Nomura Securities said.
The bonds will be priced at par, and coupon payments will be made twice a year.
The breakdown of the terms is as follows:
AMT 50 bln yen COUPON 5.0% MATURITY Nov 29, 1999
TYPE dual samurai ISS PRICE par PAY DATE Nov 27, 1996
SUB PERIOD Nov 11 to Nov 26 SIGN DATE Nov 7, 1996
NOTES: The coupon will be paid in yen, while redemption will be in dollars. Holders of the samurai bonds will receive $4,380.20 for each 500,000 yen bond held at maturity.
